intro: Charianthus, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Charianthus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xeriscaping and ecological restoration projects.
